page.title: 18PETERSFIELD FESTIVAL - YOUTH
page.content: This year six schools took part in the Youth Concerts. We always learn the songs at our own schools then practise all together before the day. On the day of the concert we all rehearse in the Festival Hall. We do the same concert on two evenings so all our parents and friends can get in to listen. We sang "Dracula! or The Vampire Vanquished" by Carey Blyton. A group of children from Dunhurst school played the accompaniments, and others told the story. We really enjoyed it. The choirs sang some two-part songs and Petersfield School Orchestra and Brass Ensemble played for us. The Area String Orchestra did a group of pieces. At the end we all joined in together to play and sing the March from "Aida" by Verdi.
